Setup database connection and install SQuirreL SQL Client
To be able to connect you need to allow access to Polarions database and add a user for it.
Go into polarion.properties and add following code.

#Settings for external access to database
com.polarion.platform.sql.externalUserPassword=YOURPASSWORD
com.polarion.platform.sql.tcpPort=9092
com.polarion.platform.sql.pgPort=5435
 

After restart of the server open the server logfile (the last updated one) and search for "database". This should lead you to two connection strings, to the Polarion HEAD, and Historic database to be used in squirrel.

Squirrel is a free SQL Client. Search in the internet for it, download and install it following the instructions.
Download Link: www.squirrelsql.org/#installation 

 Please also download and install H2 driver (jar file from "all plattforms" link) by copying the file to lib folder of Squirrel.
Download Link: www.h2database.com/html/main.html 

 Hint: Add H2 Driver ( eg. h2-1.3.174.jar ) in the lib folder of Squirrel installation folder (eg.squirrel-sql-3.5.0\lib )
Useful Documentation can be found in Polarion Help /polarion/sdk/doc/database/ExternalDatabaseConnection.pdf
Default URL is:
 jdbc:h2:tcp://your server name or ip:9092/C:\Polarion\polarion\..\data\workspace\polarion-data\database\polarion

After installation open Squirell, and add a new alias. Use H2 as driver and use the login credentials you defined before.
The URL is the the one from the log file.

Now you should be able to connect to Polarions database.
